definition: to be disappointing/to fail to live up to expectations
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: And I believe you can get that fag he-man star of mine off heroin.
sentences.chinese: 我也相信你可以让我那个不争气的男明星远离海洛因。

sentences.english: But I would fall so that if I do not live up to expectations.
sentences.chinese: 可我要是因此就堕落那就是我的不争气。

sentences.english: Why did you welcome a bad son like him?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么要欢迎这样一个不争气的儿子呢？

sentences.english: Talking of his disappointing son, the old father flew into a rage.
sentences.chinese: 说起他的那个不争气的儿子，老父亲勃然大怒。

sentences.english: Trillion home see to filial piety do dessert, denounced him unwillingly.
sentences.chinese: 兆荣回家看见至孝在做甜品，斥他不争气。

sentences.english: I already knew about the lousy cars.
sentences.chinese: 我已经知道那些个不争气的车子。

sentences.english: You need not be afraid of my deserting you, unless you give me cause.
sentences.chinese: 你不用担心我会抛弃你，除非你自己不争气。

sentences.english: Perhaps I really do not disappointing, it has repeatedly let her down.
sentences.chinese: 或许我真的很不争气，屡屡让她失望吧。

sentences.english: This chap has let us down.
In the second to give up, never again indulge disappointing heart.
sentences.chinese: 就在这一秒放弃，绝不再放纵不争气的心。

sentences.english: I lie prone at the depending of front row carry on the back up, don't fight to excel of the tears still flowed downed.
sentences.chinese: 我趴在了前排的靠背上，不争气的眼泪还是流了下来。

sentences.english: Dante: Well, if the kid screws up, then I'll just have to kick his ass.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，如果那个孩子不争气，我会真得踢他的屁股的。

definition: to work hard for sth/to resolve on improvement/determined not to fall short
to be born under an ill star

pinyin: lan4 ni2 fu2 bu4 shang4 qiang2

definition: lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to beat one's chest and stamp one's feet (idiom)
to cause or lead to sth bad
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
